title: Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of Windham Mountain
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commemorating  the  50th Anniversary of Windham
Mountain

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  the  quality  of
life of the citizens of the State of New York is greatly enriched by the
availability of exceptional recreational facilities; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commem-
orate  the  50th  Anniversary  of  Windham Mountain, to be celebrated on
January 22-23, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, The idea of a ski resort in the northern Catskills was intro-
duced by a New York State legislative committee in the late 1950s;  they
considered developing a state-run resort on Cave Mountain, just off Main
Street in the Town of Windham; and
  WHEREAS,  Although  this  particular project never advanced beyond the
discussion stage, the idea took hold and a group  of  private  investors
purchased  the  land  for  a  ski  area in 1960 and Windham Mountain was
developed; during its 50 years of existence the resort has become  asso-
ciated with customer care and attentiveness to its guests; and
  WHEREAS,  In 1960 a private group purchased land and opened Cave Moun-
tain Ski Area, which was run by the Macomber family; in  1963,  the  ski
lodge was built by Avalanche Corporation after ownership was transferred
to  Tom  and Bob Sheridan; the first snowmaking effort covered 12 acres;
and
  WHEREAS, In 1967, residential  development  began,  and  club  members
owned 58 properties on the mountain by 1975; and
  WHEREAS,  Through  the  years,  the mountain made significant improve-
ments, and by 1998, Mountain Top Adventure Park opened  for  tubing  and
Wanderer  Trail  was  built  on East Peak; in 2001, New Windham Mountain
name represented the enjoyment of all snow sports on the mountain; and
  WHEREAS, In 2005, a group of local investors,  organized  by  longtime
resort  president  Dan Frank, purchased Windham Mountain and began plan-
ning more mountain improvements; in 2006, new  owners  Windham  Mountain
Partners  invested  a  significant  amount  for  three  new  chair lifts
(including a high-speed, detachable quad),  three  new  trails,  an  ice
skating center and the new Trail's End Tavern & Grill; and
  WHEREAS, In 2008, more was invested in Windham's base lodge, including
exterior  improvements,  an  expanded  retail  shop,  new cafe, improved
firepit area, new barbecue and grill on the patio and The Club at  Wind-
ham Mountain; and
  WHEREAS, A true asset to society, Windham Mountain celebrates 50 years
of  alpine  history  and  looks  forward to another 50 years of creating
memorable experiences; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate the 50th Anniversary of Windham Mountain; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Windham Mountain Partners, LLC.
